DOC.brief_summary: Comparison of physical activity parameters of the lower extremity muscles in patients who received total extraperitoneal repair (TEP) and STOPPA repair.
DOC.brief_title: Impacts of Stoppa and Total Extraperitoneal Inguinal Hernia Repair on the Lower Extremity Muscular Functions
DOC.detailed_description: The patients were evaluated during the preoperative period and in the postoperative day 3, to achieve an isometric and isokinetic, objective assessment of the pain-related lower extremity muscular function changes.
DOC.criteria: Unilateral inguinal hernia Contralateral hernia repair history Recurrent inguinal hernia Incarceration or strangulation Bilateral inguinal hernia Severe congestive heart failure Severe hypertension Rheumatoid arthritis Systemic or neurologic diseases altering lower extremity functions
